# Privacy Policy for Do One Thing

**Effective Date:** February 1, 2026

## Introduction
**Do One Thing** ("we", "our", or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how our Chrome Extension handles your information.

## Data Collection and Usage
**We do not collect, store, or transmit any personal data.**

*   **Local Storage**: All data generated by the extension (including tasks, focus history, and settings) is stored locally on your device using the Chrome Storage API (`chrome.storage.local`).
*   **No Analytics**: We do not use Google Analytics, cookies, or any third-party tracking scripts.
*   **No Server Sync**: Your data never leaves your browser environment. We do not have servers, and we do not have access to your data.

## Permissions Usage
The extension requests the following permissions for functionality purposes only:

| Permission | Purpose |
| :--- | :--- |
| `storage` | To save your preferences, tasks, and timer stats locally. |
| `sidePanel` | To display the application interface in the browser side panel. |
| `alarms` | To run the focus timer reliably in the background. |
| `notifications` | To alert you when a focus session ends. |

## Third-Party Services
This extension operates entirely standalone. It does not communicate with external APIs or services.

## Changes to This Policy
We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.

## Contact Us
If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us by opening an issue on our [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/your-username/do-one-thing).
